Description: Rim and body sherd of Attic, perhaps black-figured, pottery band-cup or skyphos with concave offset lip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black below; exterior: lip glazed; dilute line at top of reserved handle zone; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The suffix "C" was added by the British Museum's Naukratis cataloguing project to distinguish the sherd from other 1912.40 sherds. There is no evidence of black figure related incision on the sherd.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0541) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
